snippet: After the Greek and French elections, growth is now a priority in Europe, but significant change may depend on how far Germany is willing to budge from austerity.
abstract: Emphasis across Europe, even in the austerity heartland of Germany, has shifted to the very real problem of growth in wake of raucous elections that nearly destroyed the political establishment in Greece and ended 17 years of conservative reign in France.

byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from Paris, Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome, and Raphael Minder from Madrid.

lead_paragraph: After the Greek and French elections, growth is now a priority in Europe, but significant change may depend on how far Germany is willing to budge from austerity.

headline.seo: A Divided Europe Focuses on Growth After Elections
headline.main: After Elections, Europe Focuses on Growth
headline.print_headline: After Votes, Europe Focuses on Growth, but Is Divided on Path Ahead
